headline.print_headline: Kentucky Heads to Final Four; Its Next Goal Is a State Title
headline.seo: N.C.A.A. Tournament — Kentucky Heads to Final Four
headline.main: Kentucky in Final Four; Its Next Goal Is a State Title

docs.snippet: No. 1 Kentucky jumped to a double-digit lead over Baylor early in the game, easily defeating the Bears to set up a meeting with its in-state rival, Louisville, in the Final Four....
docs.abstract: Kentucky defeats Baylor, 82-70, in NCAA men's basketball tournament Round of 8.
docs.lead_paragraph: No. 1 Kentucky jumped to a double-digit lead over Baylor early in the game, easily defeating the Bears to set up a meeting with its in-state rival, Louisville, in the Final Four.

headline.print_headline: Serenity That Barely Masks The Passion and the Whimsy
headline.seo: Yefim Bronfman Recital at Carnegie Hall
headline.main: Serenity That Barely Masks the Passion and the Whimsy

docs.snippet: After a rocky 2011 that included a finger injury, the pianist Yefim Bronfman came to Carnegie Hall on Friday with a program of Haydn, Prokofiev and Brahms....
docs.abstract: Steve Smith reviews solo recital by by pianist Yefim Bronfman at Carnegie Hall.
docs.lead_paragraph: After a rocky 2011 that included a finger injury, the pianist Yefim Bronfman came to Carnegie Hall on Friday with a program of Haydn, Prokofiev and Brahms.

headline.print_headline: Bell Tones Are Ringing in Percussion and Piano Program
headline.seo: Yarn/Wire Plays Percussion and Piano at Issue Project Room
headline.main: Bell Tones Are Ringing in Percussion and Piano Program

docs.snippet: Yarn/Wire, a quartet with two percussionists and two pianists, began a residency at the Issue Project Room in Brooklyn on Thursday....
docs.abstract: Steve Smith reviews performance by Yarn/Wire, quartet of two pianists and two percussionists, at the Issue Project Room.
docs.lead_paragraph: Yarn/Wire, a quartet with two percussionists and two pianists, began a residency at the Issue Project Room in Brooklyn on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Notre Dame Rolls as St. Bonaventure’s Run Comes to End
headline.content_kicker: Women's N.C.A.A. Tournament: Notre Dame 79, St. Bonaventure 35
headline.main: Notre Dame Rolls as St. Bonaventure’s Run Comes to End
headline.kicker: Women's N.C.A.A. Tournament: Notre Dame 79, St. Bonaventure 35

docs.snippet: The Fighting Irish took one more step toward a return trip to the national championship game with a 79-35 dismissal of the Bonnies....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Fighting Irish took one more step toward a return trip to the national championship game with a 79-35 dismissal of the Bonnies.

headline.print_headline: Scrutiny For Supplier In Collapse Of Crane
headline.seo: Supplier of Part in 2008 Crane Collapse Is Under Scrutiny
headline.main: In 2008 Crane Collapse, Scrutiny on Supplier of Part

docs.snippet: The company that handled the welding of a crucial component in a crane that killed two workers in Manhattan described itself online in ways that were largely inflated or false....
docs.abstract: Prosecutors in New York manslaughter trial of James F Lomma, whose company owned construction crane that collapsed on Upper East Side in 2005, killing two workers, continue to highlight the incompetence of RTR Bearing, Chinese company hired to make critical repairs on crane's turntable; evidence underscores risk in trusting far-flung companies whose credentials on Web sites and brochures are hard for Western companies looking for suppliers in China to verify.
docs.lead_paragraph: The company that handled the welding of a crucial component in a crane that killed two workers in Manhattan described itself online in ways that were largely inflated or false.

headline.print_headline: European Leaders Warn Against Backsliding on Spending Cuts
headline.main: European Leaders Warn Against Backsliding on Spending Cuts

docs.snippet: At a conference in Finland this weekend, they used their attendance to renew stern warnings to euro zone members against backsliding on commitments to cut spending....
docs.lead_paragraph: At a conference in Finland this weekend, they used their attendance to renew stern warnings to euro zone members against backsliding on commitments to cut spending.

headline.print_headline: Europe Changes Tone on Telecommunications Initiatives
headline.main: Europe Changes Tone on Telecommunications Initiatives

docs.snippet: Europe once worked with telecommunications companies to create a mobile standard for the world -- GSM. But now, efforts to define practices are being met with regulatory scrutiny....
docs.lead_paragraph: Europe once worked with telecommunications companies to create a mobile standard for the world -- GSM. But now, efforts to define practices are being met with regulatory scrutiny.

docs.snippet: It is increasingly unlikely that the European Union will adopt a so-called Robin Hood tax. While it will be difficult to revamp taxes on financial institutions, now is the time to act....
docs.lead_paragraph: It is increasingly unlikely that the European Union will adopt a so-called Robin Hood tax. While it will be difficult to revamp taxes on financial institutions, now is the time to act.

headline.print_headline: Looking Back, With Little Hope Of Going Back
headline.seo: Dwane Casey Still Roots for Kentucky, for Whom He Took a Fall
headline.main: Looking Back, With Little Hope of Going Back

docs.snippet: As a college assistant, Dwane Casey was punished more severely than the head coach for infractions, but he has forged a career in the N.B.A....
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column profiles Toronto Raptors coach Dwane Casey; says that Casey, who lost his assistant job at Kentucky in 1988 recruiting scandal, has never come close to returning to the college ranks, but continues to remain loyal to his alma mater; notes that Casey is excited for Kentucky, which is preparing for NCAA tournament Final Four.
docs.lead_paragraph: As a college assistant, Dwane Casey was punished more severely than the head coach for infractions, but he has forged a career in the N.B.A.

headline.print_headline: A Broad Sampling of New Classical Works
headline.seo: American Composers Orchestra, at Zankel Hall
headline.main: A Broad Sampling of New Classical Works

docs.snippet: The American Composers Orchestra played a wide-ranging sampler of contemporary classical works, from Babbitt and Copland to Michael Daugherty and Gabriel Kahane....
docs.abstract: Allan Kozinn reviews performance by the American Composers Orchestra at Zankel Hall.
docs.lead_paragraph: The American Composers Orchestra played a wide-ranging sampler of contemporary classical works, from Babbitt and Copland to Michael Daugherty and Gabriel Kahane.
